Brown during the "Lost City 2005" expedition sponsored by the National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration (NOAA) Office of Ocean Exploration, July 17 through August 4, 2005. Measurements include ship's position and heading, air temperature, relative humidity, barometric pressure, wind speed and direction, chlorophyll, sea surface temperature, and salinity. This data set was compiled from NOAA's Shipboard Computer System (SCS).</gco:CharacterString>          </gmd:abstract>          <gmd:purpose>             <gco:CharacterString>This data set was compiled in support of a demonstration of the prototype NOAA Office of Ocean Exploration Digital Atlas. It was formatted for incorporation into a Geographic Information System database.</gco:CharacterString>          </gmd:purpose>          <gmd:credit>             <gco:CharacterString>NOAA produced the original SCS data from sensors and instruments aboard the Ronald H. Brown. The NOAA Office of Ocean Exploration funded the cruise in the 2005 "Lost City" expedition.</gco:CharacterString>          </gmd:credit>          <gmd:status>             <gmd:MD_ProgressCode codeList="http://www.isotc211.org/2005/resources/Codelist/gmxCodelists.xml#MD_ProgressCode"                                  codeListValue="completed">completed</gmd:MD_ProgressCode>          <gmd:evaluationMethodDescription>                   <gco:CharacterString>The data set is based on ship's position every hour for the duration of the cruise. Some measurements were not available for every hour, either because the data for certain instruments were not provided (first few hours of expedition, time in port, and last few hours of the expedition) or certain instruments had malfunctioned. Missing or deleted data are represented as blank cells or as MM.</gco:CharacterString>                </gmd:evaluationMethodDescription>                <gmd:result gco:nilReason="unknown"/>             </gmd:DQ_CompletenessCommission>          </gmd:report>          <gmd:report>             <gmd:DQ_CompletenessOmission>                <gmd:evaluationMethodDescription>                   <gco:CharacterString>The data set is based on ship's position every hour for the duration of the cruise. Some measurements were not available for every hour, either because the data for certain instruments were not provided (first few hours of expedition, time in port, and last few hours of the expedition) or certain instruments had malfunctioned. Missing or deleted data are represented as blank cells or as MM.</gco:CharacterString>                </gmd:evaluationMethodDescription>                <gmd:result gco:nilReason="unknown"/>             </gmd:DQ_CompletenessOmission>          </gmd:report>          <gmd:report>             <gmd:DQ_ConceptualConsistency>                <gmd:measureDescription>                   <gco:CharacterString>No logical inconsistencies</gco:CharacterString>                </gmd:measureDescription>                <gmd:result gco:nilReason="unknown"/>             </gmd:DQ_ConceptualConsistency>          </gmd:report>          <gmd:lineage>             <gmd:LI_Lineage>                <gmd:processStep>                   <gmi:LE_ProcessStep>                      <gmd:description>                         <gco:CharacterString>***** NAVIGATION and HEADING: Retrieved hourly position from POSITION_001.ELG file (on the hour +10/-0 seconds) from DAILY_SCS_DATA directory ***** WEATHER (except winds) and FLUOROMETER: Retrieved hourly weather measurements from OBS_001.ELG (on the hour +10/-0 seconds) from DAILY_SCS_DATA directory ***** WINDS: Retrieved hourly heading from WIND_001.ELG (on the hour +10/-0 seconds) from DAILY_SCS_DATA directory ****** INTEGRATING DATA INTO SINGLE GIS LAYER: Combined data from individual instrument and sensor worksheets with ship's navigation information into an ESRI point shapefile. Resulting ESRI shapefile was loaded into Oracle as an SDE layer.</gco:CharacterString>                      </gmd:description>                      <gmd:dateTime>
